meanings.definition: To bill again for a product or service.
meanings.sent1: I will rebill the customer for the repair service.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to rebill the client for the additional features.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic had to rebill the customer after the payment got lost in the mail.
meanings.sent4: She had to rebill the client multiple times to ensure the payment was received.
meanings.sent5: The software system can automatically rebill customers for subscription renewals.

meanings.definition: A bill that is sent out again for payment.
meanings.sent1: The rebill was necessary due to an error in the initial invoice.
meanings.sent2: The accountant prepared the rebill for the outstanding balance.
meanings.sent3: The rebill caused confusion as the client thought they had already paid.
meanings.sent4: Receiving a rebill reminded him of the forgotten payment.
meanings.sent5: The rebill included a note explaining the reason for the additional charge.
